comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: ourswasthemarshcountry.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/e-chat... is a picture from an earlier time. deptfordpudding.com/2012/03/19/cobblers-to-the-world/ is another more recent one.

comment.author: 86905786@N02
comment._content: Most of the red buildings and the docks to the left still stand today and form the World Heritage Site known as Chatham Historic Dockyard along with the Ropery and many ships like HMS Caverlier. I live to the very left on St. Mary's Island that was once part of the Royal Naval Base, but the Royal Navy left in the 80's and Chatham Maritime as it is now known, is very different with homes, retail areas and 3 Universities!
